adverbs.description: unnecessarily (comparative more unnecessarily, superlative most unnecessarily)

entries.meaning: In an unnecessary way; not by necessity.
examples: Synonyms: needlessly, pointlessly, uselessly, for no reason
He unnecessarily repeated much of what others had covered.

entries.meaning: To an extent beyond what is needed.
examples: The food provided was unnecessarily generous, especially for an event meant to raise money for the hungry.
